description: We are looking for a Technical Lead to lead a cross functional team serving our customer's needs.  THE ROLE    An obsessive automator who only wants to manually test things once.   A concise documenter who takes as much care of their README.md as they do their service interface.   An owner end to end, Frontend, Backend, CI/CD, Operations, understanding what it takes to build a resilient, scalable service and support it in production.   A problem solver focused on user experience.   A team leader, with prior experience mentoring junior engineers and facing off to business stakeholders.   Experienced with React and Ruby or similar frameworks   Familiar with AWS, Kubernetes and write your applications Docker first.  YOUR TASKS    Lead a team of engineers to drive monetisation initiatives within the company.   Build high quality, fault tolerant systems and products, owning all areas of implementation, frontend, backend, CI pipeline, automated test suites and operations.   Work with your product owner and business stakeholders to define the product and tech roadmaps.   Mentor the engineers within your team.   Engage with the wider engineering organization, making sure your tech roadmap aligns with the other teams

Are you a highly skilled and driven individual looking to take your career to the next level? Look no further than Terra Systems! We are a dynamic company with hundreds of employees across the Asia Pacific region, specializing in innovative communications solutions and services using cutting-edge AI and Cybersecurity technologies.  We are seeking a Tech Sales Rockstar to join our team of talented business professionals. In this role, you will be responsible for conceptualizing, developing, and executing strategic sales and marketing campaigns across multiple channels to drive and optimize key KPIs and growth metrics for our company. You will focus on Enterprise Cybersecurity and IT Solutions, including AI Software (Chatbot, DMS, and Workflow Management), and will be expected to contact potential clients and business partners to establish rapport and collaborate with the Marketing and Business Development Divisions to generate a strong pipeline of leads.  At Terra, we believe in fostering a culture that rewards excellence and encourages accountability. We understand that every decision we make has a direct impact on the success of our company, and we hold ourselves to the highest standards of professionalism and integrity. We are looking for someone who is confident and able to display leadership qualities, is a strong communicator with excellent verbal and written skills, creative with a keen eye for details, and a proactive team player who enjoys working with other highly motivated individuals.  To be considered for this role, you must have at least 5 years of business development and/or relationship management experience in the IT or Cybersecurity industry, with a demonstrated track record of success in B2B sales. You must possess a degree in IT or a relevant field, excellent communication and presentation skills, and the ability to build rapport. The ideal candidate will have a strong business acumen, be dynamic and highly adaptable to the business's needs and priorities and possess the ability to multitask and wear many hats if required.  If you are looking to make an impact and play a part in shaping the AI and Cybersecurity Technology industry globally, we encourage you to send your CV and expected salary to us. Join our team of talented business professionals to plan and execute business initiatives that support Terra's business growth in the Asia Pacific region!

jobTitle: Tech Talent - Technology Associate ( Graduate Program)
description: Job Responsibilities:    Attach to high-value IT or engineering projects in the areas of  innovative technical solutions, solutions development and delivery, project management, engineering system operations, infrastructure services support and management   Be exposed to the areas of cloud computing, digital solutions, loT, big data, enterprise applications (SAP / Oracle), software systems application, IT infrastructure operations and applications support   Exciting opportunity to gain exposure in the trending areas of Data      Analytics, Business Analyst, IoT, Customer Experience Journey and Block      Chain   Develop a rewarding career in an advanced, fast-paced and  multicultural environment.  Job Requirements:    Bachelor / Master degree in Computer Science, Electronic ; Electrical / Information Engineering, Data Analytics, System Engineering  or related disciplines with less than 2 years of full-time working experience   Good presentation, interpersonal and communication skills   A team player with good analytical and problem-solving skills and who relishes challenges   Good command of spoken and written English

jobTitle: Tech Lead Manager, Fleet Management - Infrastructure Engineeering
description: About ByteDance Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.   Why Join Us At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance.  About the Infrastructure Engineering Team Our infrastructure team supports the company's fast growth by building and operating hyper-scale datacenters, managing the life cycle of server fleet, providing cloud solutions, and developing various infrastructure services and making sure they are scalable and are reliable.  Responsibilities • Grow and lead a team of engineers committed to building and operating platforms and systems that monitor, maintain, upgrade and dispatch workload over our planet-scale server fleet. • Test, evaluate, benchmark, introduce and quality control server hardware in a production environment. • Be both technically hands-on and people manager. Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your project peers. • Communicate cross-functionally across various teams, organizations and internal and external stakeholders to drive engineering efforts. • Lead the team's innovation efforts, bring in new ideas and technologies.  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: • Master’s degree (or Bachelor's degree with 5+ years of experience) in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related major • 5+ years experience working with Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond • 5+ years experience in one or more programming languages such as Go, Java, C++ and Python. • 3+ years of direct management experience in a technology company or experience as a technical lead and experience in formal project management or business training.  Preferred qualifications: • Building platforms, automation and tools to manage server fleet, their life cycles and systems running on top. • Building tools and systems that test, troubleshoot and measure the performance of server hardware • Successful experience in establishing product visions, managing roadmaps and product delivery. • Excellent analytical, comprehension, communication, writing, and consultative skills • Experience in a production and hyper-scale environment   ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Roles and Responsibilities:    Develop detailed product requirements and conduct market readiness evaluations during testing phases to ensure product quality and performance goals are met.   Participate in cross-functional teams to resolve business issues related to technology projects with significant business impact   Participate in technology projects for small product enhancements and minor customizations   Serve as Subject Matter Expert (SME) on product customization projects and influence decisions through advice, counsel, and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization   Document new products and/or changes to existing products, ensure smooth business implementation during launch process, and prioritize and validate potentially dynamic material from multiple sources using analytical skills   Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the MVGX's reputation, and safeguarding its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing, and reporting control issues with transparency.  Requirements:    A bachelor's degree or above with a computer science related major.   Minimum of 3 to 5 years relevant experience of product management and software development programming experience.   Familiar with AGILE methodology   Previous working experience within at least one of the following sectors, Financial Institutions, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG), Fintech industry.   Proven track record in project management and as a product analyst or equivalent preferably in a financial institution.   Strong financial product design capability and ability to understand user experience and a mindset of developing scalable and portable solutions.   PMP certification or equivalent will be advantageous.   Strong knowledge of the operational model of an exchange and/or knowledge of trading environments (securities, listed derivatives, and OTC products) would be preferred.   Fluency in both English and Mandarin   Result-oriented, hands-on, and diligent.   A team player that collaborates well with other departments.  If you are looking to be part of an exciting team within the financial technology industry, we would like to hear from you. Remuneration will be commensurate with experience and qualifications. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

We, at xNara, are looking for a Team Lead to join the tech team in a time when we are scaling up our business and expanding into Dubai, Singapore and India. You will be involved in building up the team as well as the tech platform to support the business requirements.  As a key team member, you have planning and supervisory responsibilities which will utilise your past work experience to achieve the best outcomes. The team will also look to you for expert advise in helping them to get past development roadblocks. You will be expected to have a hands-on involvement in delivering the tech output. You should exude curiosity and passion in the tech domain and instil those qualities in the team.  What you will be doing? Team Management    Lead by example in demonstrating strong work ethics.   Work effectively in a multi-national team.   Be an excellent communicator.   Promote and maintain a positive work culture amongst team members.   Identify and cultivate competency and work excellence in the team.   Proficient in Agile.  Product Development    Be an innovative problem solver.   Embody a progressive work attitude and be independent in approaching work.   Ensure that work execution by team follows best practices and industry standards.   Able to translate business and operational requirements to tech planning and implementation.   Advocates structure and organization in daily work within the team.   Actively contribute to day-to-day development work for the xNara platform.   Perform and organise code reviews for the team.  What will you bring to the role?    6+ years in a similar role.   Expert in Node and/or Java.   Be proficient in 2 or more server-side languages.   Have expertise in 2 or more database technologies (MySQL, MS Sql Server, MongoDB, Postgres).   Expert in build orchestration (Kubernetes) and containerisation (Docker).   Expert in managing cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure).   Expert in version control branch planning and management.   Familiar in DevOps planning and management.   Working experience in managing mobile app projects.   Working experience in working with Big Data services (Data Lake, Data Warehouse) is a plus.   BS in Computer Science, MIS or similar field.

Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading IT solution and service provider headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency. We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation. We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team. If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you. What will you do?    The Solutions Architect/Tech Lead analyses, designs and develops roadmaps and implementation plans based on a current versus future state solutions architecture.   You lead and facilitate the solutions architecture governance processes and manages exceptions to architectural standards at a solutions level.   You assess near-term needs to establish business priorities, analyses and develop solutions architectural requirements, and ensures alignment of architectural requirements with the IT strategy. He analyses the current architecture to identify weaknesses and identifies opportunities for improvement and performs ongoing architecture quality review activities.   You work in a dynamic and evolving business environment   You are familiar with enterprise architecture methodologies and frameworks, architecture modelling tools, as well as product development methodologies.   You are knowledgeable about digital product development of industrial Internet of Things, applications and web services.   He possess strong leadership and communication abilities, is creative and innovative in nature, and is able to influence key stakeholders.   Formulate the organisation's architecture strategy, roadmap, standards, policies   Lead and coordinate the domain technical and business discussions   Participate in ecosystem strategy development, environment analyses and opportunity identification   Analyse, design and develop roadmaps and implementation plans based on a current versus future state   Design standard configurations and patterns   Lead and facilitate the solutions architecture governance process   Manage exceptions to architectural standards at a solutions level   Develop architecture requirements and maintain oversight   Analyse and develop solutions architectural requirements   Align architectural requirements with IT strategy   Assess near-term needs to establish business priorities   Ensure compatibility with existing solutions, infrastructure, services and strategic requirements   Coordinate architecture implementation and modification activities   Assist in post-implementation and continuous improvement efforts to enhance performance and provide increased functionality   Ensure conceptual completeness of the technical solution   Manage quality and continuous improvement of architecture   Analyse the current architecture to identify weaknesses and develop opportunities for improvement   Identify and propose variances to the architecture to accommodate project needs   Perform ongoing architecture quality review activities   Research emerging technologies   Consults with clients and IT teams on solutions architecture   Analyses cost versus benefits, risks, impact and technology priorities   Provide recommendations on emerging technology to senior management   Develop communication plans for solutions architecture   Lead the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry and market trends to assist in product development   Identify organisational requirements for resources   Drive implementation of solutions architecture   Design and lead the implementation of the solution architecture   Define repeatable rules for the implementation of solutions in repeatable or reusable ways  What are we looking for?    Minimally 3 years of experience in software design, solutioning and architecture   Practical experience with Agile Methodologies, tools and delivery   Good understanding of Cloud Technologies   Recent relevant experience in supporting Government Projects will be an added advantage   Strong hand-on experience in C#, .Net Technologies   Ability to manage a hosting environment, including database administration as well as scaling applications to handle load changes   Experience in implementing projects with databases as well as exposure in automated software testing and system automation will be an added advantage   Analytic, conceptualization and problem-solving skillsets   Communication skills, both oral and written and able to pitch to engage stakeholders   Healthcare domain knowledge and experience in supporting applications operations will be an added advantage  What do we offer?    Fun working environment   Employee Wellness Program  Does it sound like something you are interested in exploring further? Please be in touch with our team for an initial chat at chi@activate.sg Activate Interactive Singapore is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions will be based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Activate Interactive Pte Ltd does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data are longstanding top priorities for Activate Interactive Pte Ltd. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Activate Interactive Pte Ltd’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.activate.sg/privacy-policy) to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer the personal data of our candidates. Here you can find how you can request for access, correction and/or withdrawal of your Personal Data.

Job Description: Posting Title: Technical Lead (Java) Job Summary: A Java Technical Lead designs and recommends technical solutions for IT-related issues. The responsibilities of a Java Technical Lead include working with developers to ensure quality deliverables, mentoring junior level staff, and identifying issues that affect product delivery. Job Description: We are looking for an experienced Java Technical (Tech) Lead to be responsible for providing solutions for technical issues which may affect product delivery. He or she will facilitate requirement analysis, conduct code reviews, provide feedback, and enhance frameworks. To be successful as a Java Tech Lead, you should demonstrate sound knowledge of industry best practices, good organizational and leadership skills, and proficiency in JAVA technologies. Ultimately, the Java Tech Lead should possess good analytical skills, the ability to anticipate issues and frame remedial actions, and excellent teamwork skills. Roles and Responsibilities:    To perform requirement analysis and oversee the implementation of architectures of project scope   To provide customized reusable solutions of project, program or operational scope   To develop high-quality and detailed designs   To conduct unit testing using automated unit test frameworks and identify and address possible risk by conducting mitigation action planning   Conducting configuration of your own work or from the team and assess the technical impact of multiple technologies/strategies   Reviewing the work of other developers with feedback for improvement (if applicable)   Using coding standards and best practices to ensure quality deliverables   Contribute as a team member to an operational, integration or application architecture requirements, design, implementation, or on-going operations deliverables  Requirements:    Candidate must possess at least a Diploma/Degree in Computing/Information Technology or equivalent   At least 5 years of development experience in Java   Experience in Spring/Spring Boot framework   Experience in relational databases such as Oracle and MySQL   Experience in implementing web services such as SOAP and RESTful web services   Experience in frontend frameworks such as Angular, Struts, jQuery and Bootstrap   Experience in batch processing implementations   Have implemented some form of custom frameworks such as security and validations   Have some team leading experience   Good verbal and written communication skills   Advanced understanding of modern software development methodologies   Advanced understanding of software testing methodologies, scripting and tools   Minimum experience of three or more full SDLC for web application projects   Ability to work effectively in a team and with client  Good to have:    Experience in Agile development environments   Experience in DevOps toolchains   Experience in container platforms such as Docker and Kubernetes   Experience in messaging platforms such as Kafka and IBM MQ   Experience in Application Servers configurations like WebSphere and WebLogic will be an advantage   Experience in software testing tools such as Selenium, Karate, Microfocus UFT and Katalon

Tech, Operations    Develop strategies that align with business imperatives   Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on the Straits Times and Statista’s list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021).   Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years.  Our Manufacturing Operations teams are the people that make our products. We work in the manufacturing plants with a “Safety First, Quality Always” mindset striving for continuous improvement. We work in the local plant connected to our global manufacturing network to ensure the highest quality of raw materials, intermediates and finished products.  Working in 8 hours day shift from Monday to Friday reporting to Shift Production Manager, you are responsible for supporting and executing the Packaging operations Start-Up. This involves working closely together with cross functional team to ensure Safety, Quality, Compliance and Operational aspects of the packaging lines during start-up of new vial packaging line and subsequently support routine Packaging operations activities, operation ; troubleshooting of the equipment to ensure they meet GMP, regulatory and supply requirements.  WHAT YOU WILL DO Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Safety ; Compliance    Meet site’s Safety, Health and Environment (SHE) performance objectives and participate in improvement initiatives   Perform Packaging operations as per production operational needs and ensure Safety and cGMP requirements are met.   Actively contribute to resolve problems and seek improvement opportunities within the work module assigned   Implement corrective actions as documented following regulatory inspections and internal audits.   Ensure operations related activity is completed according to established procedures and all associated documentation is completed to a high standard.   Participate in and supports the implementation of actions for Investigations and Audits.   Participate in Emergency Response Team (ERT) as a team member when assigned.  Enhance and uphold Operations Quality    Responsible for completing all assigned operational tasks, whilst ensuring documentation is accurate and completed for the assigned equipment.   Able to provide constructive feedback and solutions to issues identified in the work place.   Responsible to participate in improvement projects and actively generate ideas   Ensure both operational knowledge and technical skills are maintained and compliant based on training requirements.   Use tier meetings and other opportunities to engage positively with others so as to foster team collaboration and co-create a high performance work environment.  Operations Excellence    Meet performance metrics of the assigned operations.   Responsible for maintaining good facility housekeeping and pro-actively carry out minor repair works on packaging equipment   Effectively communicates throughout the shift and during shift handover. Escalate operational issues to appropriate level when required.   Provide detailed information for all operational events to assist in Quality notification investigations.   Perform routine GMP equipment cleaning/minor maintenance and equipment set-up, and support area cleaning as assigned.   Resolve issues in a timely manner and participate in continuous improvement initiatives.   Situationally aware and perceptive while operating the machinery.   Ensure packaged products meet safety and quality specifications  Problem solving    Analyze and recommend solutions for identified issues   Support Production and Maintenance teams on problem solving and troubleshooting.   Able to properly assess the situation and understand when to escalate to a higher level.   Work together with the team to use 5S tool to maintain the working environment and perform Kaizen for improvement activities.  WHAT YOU MUST HAVE To be successful in this role, you will have:    O-level / Diploma in Technical Area   3 to 5 years previous manufacturing experience in the pharmaceutical or similar industry.   Strong background in operation of chemical/pharmaceutical systems including hands-on experience.   Familiarized with cGMP working environment and good understanding of safety practices   Good oral/written communication and interpersonal skills.   Basic knowledge in using Microsoft Office   Normal office working hour (Monday to Friday 8am to 5pm)  WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT    Opportunity to work in a market giant  Our Manufacturing ; Supply Division is committed to be the most trusted supplier of bio-pharmaceuticals worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, create an interdependent global manufacturing network that’s committed to delivering a high quality, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time.  Who we are… We are known as Merck ; Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.  What we look for… Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us — and start making your impact today.  We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

About the company An established information technology system integrator serving the B2B markets is looking for a hands-on Finance Manager to join their finance team.  About the job Report to the CFO, you will be leading a sizeable finance team in managing the full spectrum of financial management and oversee all accounting operations. You will ensure accurate management reporting, budgeting, planning and forecasting activities. You will be the go-to-person and advise on latest developments in financial regulatory standards, while driving continuous improvements to business processes, controls and policies. You will also support their corporate finance activities including fund-raising activities.  Skills and experience required You are professional qualified (such as, CPA/CA) with at least 6 years of hands-on finance/accounting operations experience. You have prior managerial experience, proactive and strong interpersonal skills. Due to urgency of the position, those with immediate basis or less than 1 month notice will be considered. You are also comfortable travelling to the Changi Business Park (office site).  Why is this a good role? A high visibility position as you work directly with the CFO. This is a company which provides internal mobility opportunities and has a cooperative culture.   If you are looking for a fast-paced environment, please click the 'apply' function for a smooth easy process to register your interest and CV for the role. Consultant-in-charge: Stella Tan (EA: 94C3609 \R1984239).  https://www.linkedin.com/in/sgtanstella   Applicants must be fully vaccinated or have a valid exemption in accordance with MOM’s regulations to allow them to enter the workplace. Applicants may be required to share verifiable COVID-19 vaccination documents or proof of a valid exemption at the point of offer. Randstad Pte. Limited and/or the Client reserves the right to withdraw an offer if the applicant fails to provide verifiable COVID-19 vaccination and/or proof of exemption documents.

location.address: PLAZA 8 @ CBP, 1 CHANGI BUSINESS PARK CRESCENT

description: Job Description - Should have good knowledge in Retail Banking concepts.   - Should have in depth knowledge in Cards, Loans, Mortgages, Deposits and   Derivatives.   - Should have experience as a Data Analyst with good hands on experience in   creating statistical data models using Python/R Program.   - Should be capable of interpreting the model output and provide impactful   conclusions and suggestions to improve the business.   - Knowledge in Wholesale banking products will be an added advantage.   - Should possess basic knowledge in Teradata SQL.   - Should have good communication skills and should be able to elicit   requirement's from the Clients and document them.   -Should have In- depth knowledge in Datastage.   -Should have Good understanding of Datawarehousing concepts.   -Should have Requires exceptional expertise in development and detailed   knowledge of industry trends.    -Should have Applied the highest level technical skill and expertise in   project/team leadership to highly complex projects and problems. Job Requirements Key skills required for the job are: - Data Science (Python/R Programing) - Datastage Development  - Banking Domain-L3   As a Technical Lead with the banking domain knowledge, you are responsible for supporting project teams ; team members in terms of research and background information. You are expected to elicit and detail the client requirements via industry standard analysis techniques such as data flow modeling, case analysis, workflow analysis, functional decomposition analysis, data modeling, and object modeling. You are expected to documents the results of analysis activities using appropriate templates or tools. You are responsible across areas like requirement definition, execution and evaluation of functional tests, review, testing and analysis. You are expected to be a subject matter expert in a chosen area/function. You should have in-depth knowledge in Data Science like Python/R Programming and should be able to create data models based upon the financial data and interpret the same to provide business solutions and lead the team in development/Support.

Enhance and uphold Operations Quality    Responsible for completing all assigned operational tasks, whilst ensuring documentation is accurate and completed for the assigned equipment.   Able to provide constructive feedback and solutions to issues identified in the work place.   Responsible to participate in improvement projects and actively generate ideas   Ensure both operational knowledge and technical skills are maintained and compliant based on training requirements.   Use tier meetings and other opportunities to engage positively with others so as to foster team collaboration and co-create a high performance work environment  Operations Excellence    Meet performance metrics of the assigned operations.   Responsible for maintaining good facility housekeeping and pro-actively carry out minor repair works on packaging equipment   Effectively communicates throughout the shift and during shift handover. Escalate operational issues to appropriate level when required.   Provide detailed information for all operational events to assist in Quality notification investigations.   Perform routine GMP equipment cleaning/minor maintenance and equipment set-up, and support area cleaning as assigned.   Resolve issues in a timely manner and participate in continuous improvement initiatives.   Situationally aware and perceptive while operating the machinery.   Ensure that  packaged products meet safety and quality specifications  Problem solving    Analyze and recommend solutions for identified issues   Support Production and Maintenance teams on problem solving and troubleshooting.   Able to properly assess the situation and understand when to escalate to a higher level.   Work together with the team to use 5S tool to maintain the working environment and perform Kaizen for improvement activities.  WHAT YOU MUST HAVE To be successful in this role, you will have:    O-level / Diploma in Technical Area   1-3 years previous manufacturing experience in the pharmaceutical (preferred) or similar industry.   Strong background in operation of chemical/pharmaceutical systems including hands on experience.   Familiarized with cGMP working environment and good understanding of safety practices   Good oral/written communication and interpersonal skills.   Basic knowledge in using Microsoft Office   Able to work in 12-hours rotating shift  WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT    Opportunity to work in a market giant  Our Manufacturing ; Supply Division is committed to be the most trusted supplier of bio-pharmaceuticals worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, create an interdependent global manufacturing network that’s committed to delivering a high quality, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time.  Who we are… We are known as Merck ; Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.  What we look for… Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us — and start making your impact today.  We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

company.name: NITTO DENKO ASIA TECHNICAL CENTRE PTE. LTD.

description: Job Responsibilities:    Install, upgrade, support for IT Resources including areas such as computer hardware, operating systems, applications, and any other Company’s authorized peripheral equipment   Troubleshoot system, network problems, diagnosing and solving hardware or software faults   Support IT infrastructure components such as servers, storage, networks (WAN, LAN, Firewalls, etc.) and workstations etc   Support with the testing and installation of new applications and update patches, follow-up with users to ensure the problem is resolved including maintaining an IT library.   Administer, manage and decommissioning of the IT Resources as per Company’s disposal policy and procedures   Work together with cross border team(s) including external service providers for performance of IT operations   Ensure and follow standard IT service delivery processes in accordance with Company’s IT policies and procedures   Proactively work with internal teams to optimize and improve IT support processes and procedures   Maintain up to date documentation for all IT related matters including areas for IT infrastructure components and IT operation processes   Ensure technical and application incidents within domain are addressed and resolved, record events and problems and their resolution in logs   Perform testing and evaluation of new technologies   Analyze and develop appropriate computing techniques in support for product development   Research and develop forward computing software techniques for software and application   Work with IT and software teams to provide feasible applications including review of codes   Work and support software development teams for product development.   Work with production engineering teams on app functional tests, systems, databases, and networks for NPI needs.   Drafting of documentation relating to software solutions introduced towards product development  Job Requirements:    Minimum Diploma/Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or any IT-related discipline   Working knowledge and expertise with a variety of software, hardware, and applications.   Prior experience in desktop support / IT support or in a similar role   Proficiency in Windows/Linux/Mac OS   Proficient in Microsoft Office Skills is mandatory   Experience in system/network/software troubleshooting   Certification in Microsoft, Linux, or Cisco is advantageous   Analytical skills to study problems including its records and identify plausible solutions.   Team-oriented attitude to help other colleagues and departments with technical problems   Strong interpersonal communication and relationship-building skills   Ability to manage time and effectively prioritize numerous projects at one time

Your new company We are the world's leading recruiting experts in recruiting qualified, professional and skilled people. We power the world of work by truly understanding our clients and candidates, locally and globally. We provide deep expertise across a wide spectrum of industries and sectors.  Hays operates across the private and public sectors, dealing in permanent positions, contract roles and temporary assignments. We believe the right job can transform a person's life and the right person can transform a business. Looking after the careers of professionals and directly influencing lives is something most people never have the chance to do. At Hays, you'll do it every day.  We are looking for ambitious individuals to join our growing family. If you are passionate about people, determined to be the best, thrive under pressure and respond proactively and positively to targets, a career at Hays could be for you.  Your new role As a Manager - Technology, your responsibilities include:    To maximise office fees both through individual and team results.   To oversee performance and lead consultants to meet their personal objectives whilst achieving business unit objectives   Develop and maintain all aspects of a high-performance culture   Consistently exhibit behaviour aligned with Hays values   Monitor and review business plans and KPI’s   Identify local clients with opportunities for business development within the IT Industry   Gather accurate data regarding target clients and companies via sales calls and client visits   Proactively pursue leads to establish long term relationships   Initiate business networking through professional bodies, industry groups, client and candidate referrals to build personal and corporate profile with customers  What you'll need to succeed We welcome professionals from various industries. Key qualities required:    Experience in IT Recruitment/IT Sales industry   Experience leading a team of at least 3 preferred   Exceptional motivation with strong ambition and sales-drive   Passionate about helping people flourish and achieve their career goals   Energised by connecting with new people and seeking out new relationships   Driven towards achieving results in an environment full of healthy competition   Inquisitive and curious, always wanting to know more about people and the world of work   Confident to establish new relationships   Ambitious to achieve results and progress your career   Adaptable and agile, able to constantly seek new opportunities in the market  What you'll get in return At Hays you’ll never stand still because we harness your potential. We believe in promoting our people based on merit. With world-class training and mentoring from senior leaders, the possibilities for your career are endless. As a recruitment consultant, you’ll have the opportunity to determine your career path that is aligned with your skills and interests. Achieve and you’ll be fast-tracked into people or business leadership. We have transparent promotion criteria, so you’ll always have a goal to work towards. We provide attractive base salary plus uncapped commission structure.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to Jessine Ng at Jessine.ng@hays.com.sg  At Hays, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our customers, and our community. Hays is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that embraces diversity and strives to be inclusive environment for our people. Role:Data Tech Lead  Job Descriptions:    Development of new data management layers and build data processes.   Solutioning and Tech Designing for Data Systems   Tech Led to drive data engineering activities   Provide support for enhancements and any BAU issues on the new data management layers and existing data lakes.   Support and migration of existing on-premises databases to AWS cloud.   Understanding the existing applications, data architecture, and suggest improvements   Lead business requirements and plan deliveries.   Handle data extractions and data analysis for the requirements.  Job Requirements:    Minimum of 10+ years of experience with Information Technology using RDBMS and Non-RDBMS and Cloud databases.   8+ years of strong hands-on experience on any of the databases like SQL/PLSQL, Oracle, MS-SQL server, Postgres, and Snowflake.   3+ years of strong experience in AWS Cloud.   Good understanding of Data integration, Data Flows, Data Quality, Data Architecture and Data Engineering.   Technical expertise in data models, data mining and segmentation techniques.   Experience in Tech Design and Solution Designing for data systems   Experience with full SDLC lifecycle and Lean or Agile development methodologies.   AWS tools and components knowledge is a plus.   CI/CD and GIT exposure   Experience on UNIX shell scripts.   Ability to work in team in diverse/multiple stakeholder environment   Ability to communicate complex technology solutions to diverse teams namely, technical, business and management teams

Roles and Responsibilities:    Responsible for the company's product planning, analyze user requirements, market trends, competition trends and user groups, and reasonably plan the scope of demand.   Manage the Business Application team to oversee application development and project management to ensure timely deployment and smooth operations of the IT systems in accordance with IT policies and technology standards.   Lead the product planning according to the company's product and business development direction, complete planning   Comprehend the core value of the product to drive product innovation and ensure that product functions meet user needs.   Define product functions, be responsible for the management of product requirements, collect, refine, and organize user requirements, and write product requirement documents.   Work closely with multiple teams such as business development, testing, and operations, continuously improve product user experience, provide corresponding product training for business departments, ensure iterative and efficient version functions, and promote product goals.   Continuously monitor/analyze user feedback and data analysis results after the product “goes live” and define roadmap improvement plans.   Develop and continuously refine the architecture design of the solutions according to business requirements, and the split design of horizontal and vertical modules, so that the solution architecture is scalable as the business develops.   Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the MVGX's reputation, and safeguarding its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing, and reporting control issues with transparency.  Requirements:    A bachelor's degree or above in computer related major.   Minimum 8 years of product technology team management experience.   Excellent innovative thinking, strong product design and user interface design ability, and sensitive to user experience.   Familiar with AGILE methodology   Previous working experience within at least one of the following sectors, Financial Institutions, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG), Fintech industry.   Solid software development capabilities and a mindset of developing scalable and portable solutions.   Strong analysis and communication management can build consensus with business and technical teams.   Strong knowledge of the operational model of an exchange and/or knowledge of trading environments (securities, listed derivatives and OTC) would be preferred.   Desirable leadership mindset and capabilities, with the ability to effectively collaborate across all departments.   Result-oriented, diligent and excellent team spirit.   A team player that collaborates well with other departments.   Fluency in both English and Mandarin  If you are looking to be part of an exciting team within the financial technology industry, we would like to hear from you. Remuneration will be commensurate with experience and qualifications. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
